subject: How to advertise effectively even if you can't spend thousands
content:
Do you try running facebook or instagram ads just to feel like you're lighting your money on fire?

Well {{ subscriber.first_name }}, you're not alone my friend.

I have talked to 437 basketball trainers over the past 8 months (yes, I counted). The vast majorities' experience with advertising goes something like this:

They try running ads by boosting post or sending traffic directly to their website.

They don't set up the pixel and if they do, they don't configure events properly (this allows facebook to track everything).

They let the campaign run for a few days judging based on link clicks and total impressions to see how the ads performed.

They are unsure whether or not it helped bring them new business and conclude facebook ads don't work.

Sound familiar?

I get it... dealing with the entire set up process, constantly testing new ads, offers, angles and funnels is time consuming and frustrating.

But with great struggle comes great opportunity.

Ya see {{ subscriber.first_name }}, 99% of basketball trainers are not using paid advertising to its' fullest capability.

And what this does is it creates a huge gap between the 1% that advertise effectively and everyone else, allowing those who do to have MASSIVE success.

I'm sure you have a handful of competitors in your area and I'm gonna assume you offer a better training service than all of them (you wouldn't be receiving this email if you didn't).

If you've given up on paid ads, all you're doing is allowing another trainer the opportunity to swoop in and steal clients from you.

Give your training program the justice it deserves and join the top 1% of trainers who take the time to learn how to advertise effectively.

Whats that you say? You want to give paid ads another shot?

Guess what {{ subscriber.first_name }}, it must be your lucky day because I'm opening up a few spots on my calendar for the next week.

If you want me to directly walk you through a bulletproof, battle tested, surefire way to run ROI driven Facebook/ Instagram ads, book a call with me here.

First come, first serve.

Chat soon killer,

Ben

P.S. - What are you still doing here? Book a call before another trainer beats you to it.​

subject: (story time) chasing a crackhead in mexico
content:
Hi {{ subscriber.first_name }}… remember me?

You miss me?

No? Ok well I miss you.

It’s month 2 down here in Mexico and right now I’m sitting outside on the balcony of my 4 story building, overlooking the beautiful city of Playa Del Carmen.

I accidentally winked at the crackhead across the street and she is now foaming at the mouth while touching herself in places dirtier than the cartel members’ drug money.

And no, I’m not fluent in Spanish yet however a nice looking Colombian woman seduced me into taking clases de Espanol.

I’ve pretty much been in monk mode for the past month or so.

If you don’t know what monk mode is, it’s when one rids themselves of all dopamine for an extended period of time.

So for the last month, I haven’t been speaking, eating, going outside, smiling, using the bathroom, or sleeping.

I take 6 cold showers every day and start each morning with an hour-long prayer to a poster of David Goggins on my wall.

I then run 18.3 miles chasing crackheads through the Mexican jungle while listening to “Vivir mi Vida” on repeat.

Ok sorry, I got kind of carried away there.

Those past few statements might not be entirely true.

But I recently restructured the way we do things over here at Hoopr Media and it has been a lot of work.

I wanted to talk about a topic that’s been on my mind a lot lately...

Do you ever feel like the outcome you received did not correlate with the work you put in?

A few times throughout this past month I felt that exact way.

It’s frustrating.

There’s a quote in Napoleon Hills’ Think And Grow Rich that helps keep me going in times like this.

“Every failure brings with it the seed of an equivalent success.”

As of late those seeds finally started to sprout for me and I’m glad I had the patience to see it through.

I’ve been less emotionally attached to the output of my actions and solely focused on the input.

You can control what you do every day to move the needle forward.

In most cases, you cannot directly control how, when, why, and in what order things unfold the way you intend them to.

It’s in times of uncertainty that your faith and confidence in yourself are truly tested.

Will you pass that test?

Anyway, I have lesson number 2 with my Spanish tutor today. That’s a test I will pass :)

Hasta Luego,

​

Ben

​

subject: What you can learn from the dentist
content:
Hey {{ subscriber.first_name }},

I'm back.

Today I've got a great one for you my friend...

Over the past few weeks I have started working with some academy owners that are absolutely killing it.

Their gyms are consistently full, their clients pay them handsomely, and they know exactly how much money they have coming in each month, never worrying about chasing down invoices.

Sounds great doesn't it?

Well {{ subscriber.first_name }} I'm gonna tell you what separates them from everyone else... and it might now be what you think.

Odds are they aren't exponentially better than you when it comes to the on court side of the business.

And honestly I wouldn't be surprised if you went pound for pound with them when it comes to basketball training expertise.

You might be shaking your head in agreement right now...

But that's the problem.

You're only seeing 1 part of the equation.

Being a good trainer is a pre-requisite for building a successful program.

Here some all of the other factors that go into it:

  • Equipment/ Facility
  • Organization
  • Communication
  • Professionalism
  • Staff
  • Advertising
  • Systems
  • Company culture
  • Tracking

All of the big academy owners are absolutely dialed when it comes to this part of the business.

Make sense?

Let me ask you a question...

Let's say you're choosing between 2 dentists.

Dentist #1 has an outdated website and takes days to get back to you. Once you finally get ahold of him you schedule a consultation and head to the office.

You walk in seeing old rusty equipment, and listen to the surgeon continuously tell stories about how he "would've been the Michael Jordan of cleaning teeth if it weren't for his knee injury in college."

Dentist #2 has a clean, functional website that allows you to schedule online. You receive a series of text and email reminders leading up to your appointment.

Once you arrive you're greeted with a smile and brought a cup coffee as you sit down in the waiting room.

You enter to brand new equipment and images of happy clients on the walls.

The dentist is completely professional and your consultation goes in a smooth, orderly fashion.

Which one are you choosing?

Point made.

See you in the next one,

​

Ben

subject: {{ subscriber.first_name }} please join my cult
content:
Hola {{ subscriber.first_name }},

Long time no talk.

I write to you from the quiet city of Merida, Mexico.

I am now fluent in Spanish and have spread my seed among 12 baby mamas’ across the Yucatan Peninsula.

Adios, America.

Jokes aside, this is my second to last day in Mexico and I have some big news for you (name).

I know that says (name) idiot. Let's get into it, {{ subscriber.first_name }}!

When I first got into online biz, I had this idealistic belief that my time would be spent traveling and meeting cool new friends.

I quickly learned a lot of nights (especially in the beginning) are spent alone.

But now I have a network of absolute G’s that make this whole entrepreneurship thing 10x better.

I’ve built these relationships through various communities online, Twitter being the main platform.

The people I used to watch from a far are now some of my closest friends.

And if you don’t know, mi amigo Harry and I started a podcast a few months ago called Internet Kids.

The sole purpose was to have interesting conversations and connect with more people in the online biz world.

We did just that and people loved it, so we pondered the idea of making clothing and turning it into a brand.

But unless you’ve been living under a rock or are blind and deaf, you’ve heard about everything that’s going on with Web 3.

Getting deeper into this space allowed us the creativity to build something that encompasses all that the Internet Kids brand really stands for.

We want to create an environment that will allow people to connect with others and build this idealistic lifestyle that many of us have when they get into online business.

The Internet Kids NFTs will give you access to exclusive clothing, private events (first one in Miami Q1 2022), interactive games that allow you to win SOL, and white girls with parental issues.

This community will be truly special and I’d love to see your handsome (or pretty) face inside.

​Join my cult here.​

​Now!​

​NOWWW!!!!!​

See you in Miami ;)

- Ben

subject: YOUR EXTENDED WARRANTY
content:
Yo {{ subscriber.first_name }},

I was just thinking about you.

Well, not specifically you (unless you're @cardinalmason) because this is an email list but anyway:

It's a rainy Saturday down here in South Florida and I'm writing this email as a way to procrastinate going to the gym.

I just spelled the word "procrastinate" wrong 3 times.

I've been doing this thing where I sound out words instead of looking them up and it's really started to expand my vocabeloalarry.

Business is good.

Contrary to popular belief I'm not running drugs across the Mexican border (though that would be cool).

Recently I've been working on detaching my happiness to the amount of money I'm making.

I was listening to a podcast of my Twitter friend Brodie Kern and something he said really stuck with me.

"How would you operate differently if you knew the end was secure?"

I thought about it.

At 21 years old, I know I'll never have to work a regular job.

I'll make more money than my former college professors this year.

And if everything went to shit, I could build a new business and get it to $10k a month in just a few months.

I don't mean to be cocky but it's really that simple.

Sometimes I get caught up looking around at my other friends on twitter cruising around my Miami in *supercars,* making 6 figures a month, etc. **Disclaimer: A C8 is not a supercar (Tate Chronicles: 9:9)

Don't get me wrong. It's good to keep striving to one up the person you were the day before.

But don't sacrifice, your happiness, your sanity, nor your peace for after you reach a milestone.

Because odds are you'll end up getting neither.

*mic drop*

I know you missed these sarcastic 349.4 word emails, that always somehow coherently drove home a decent point at the end.

The truth is I just want your validation so if you liked this email, hit reply and let me know.

I'll send one lucky winner a half eaten klondike bar and a pack of mango juul pods.

Alright, time for me to go to the gym.

Talk soon {{ subscriber.first_name }},

Ben

Sent from my Iced Watermelon Puff Bar

subject: Take off your mask {{ subscriber.first_name }}
content:
{{ subscriber.first_name }}.

Are you still listening to them?

They tell you that you need "this" to be happy.

That you need "that" to be successful.

But they don't know YOU {{ subscriber.first_name }}.

You make your own rules.

You define your own success.

Stop abiding by their arbitrary metrics of life.

It is truly your own life.

No one shares the same lens of the world as you do.

You are an amalgamation of all of the unique experiences and perspectives you hold.

Stop robbing the world of your uniqueness.

What are you hiding?
​
What part of yourself are you running from?

Question your beliefs. Question your limitations. Remove the metaphorical box you place on yourself.

You are whoever you want to be at any given moment.

{{ subscriber.first_name }} has no boundaries.

{{ subscriber.first_name }} is limitless.

Don't let the jaded ideas of others shape your own perspective of YOU.

Aim to grow.

Aim to be better than the person you were the day before.

Carry yourself with confidence and stop second guessing your true desires.

Do the things you do for yourself and yourself only.

Make the younger version of yourself proud of the current version you have become.

And never stop growing...

... whatever that means to you {{ subscriber.first_name }}.

Thanks for reading my self improvement ramble. I listened to a guided meditation and was feeling inspired.

I'll go back to spewing nonsensical bullshit into your inbox another day.

Keep being you,

-Ben

​
